topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查冠词。句意为：与人类相比，动物显然是一种较低层次的生命形式。第一空表示“一种较低的形式”，是泛指，应用不定冠词a；第二空man泛指“人类”，其前不加冠词。故答案选A。

knowledges.name: 词法>>冠词>>不定冠词
词法>>冠词>>零冠词

subTopics.desc: （江西卷）Animals are obviously________lower form of life than________man．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查冠词用法。句意为：据说13世纪时，马可·波罗在去爪哇的途中曾在太平洋上航行过。第一空，定冠词the常用在表示世界上独一无二的事物前，the Pacific Ocean意为“太平洋”；第二空，根据序数词“thirteenth”可知，其前应用定冠词the。故D项正确。

knowledges.name: 词法>>冠词>>定冠词

subTopics.desc: （陕西卷）Marco Polo is said to have sailed on________Pacific Ocean on his way to Java in________thirteenth century．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查冠词用法。句意为：父母听到孩子需要做膝盖手术的消息震惊了。第一空后news是特指孩子需要动膝盖手术的消息，所以用定冠词the，排除A、D选项；第二空处单数可数名词不能单独使用，必须与冠词连用，此处泛指一次手术，Operation第一个字母为元音音素，其前用不定冠词an。故答案选C。

knowledges.name: 词法>>冠词>>定冠词
词法>>冠词>>不定冠词

subTopics.desc: （重庆卷）The parents were shocked by________new's that their son needed________operation on his knee．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查特殊句型。句意为：读一读这个故事，你会意识到并不是一切东西都可以用钱买到。空格前后两句之间为递进承接关系，应用and连接两个句子，构成“祈使句+and+you will...”句型。故选B。

knowledges.name: 词法>>连词和感叹词>>并列连词

subTopics.desc: （四川卷）Read this story，________you will realize that not everything can be bought with money．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查连词用法。分析句子语境可知，你必须让开，否则，卡车过不去。在四个选项中，or表示“否则”，与语境相符。故答案选B。

knowledges.name: 词法>>连词和感叹词>>并列连词

subTopics.desc: （全国新课标卷）You have to move out of the way________the truck cannot get past you．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查动词时态和语态。由语境可知，在我们小的时候，人们就教导我们诚实是最上策。we与teach之间为被动关系，排除A、B两项；根据“we are little”可知，应用一般现在时态。故C项正确。

knowledges.name: 词法>>动词时态和语态>>动词时态>>现在进行时

subTopics.desc: （上海卷）ls honesty the best policy？We________that it is when we are little．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查动词时态。根据语境可知，“我”没有听明白你的话，是因为你说话的时候“我”正在发短信息，因此选用过去进行时。故正确答案为D。

knowledges.name: 词法>>动词时态和语态>>动词时态>>过去进行时

（四川卷）―Did you catch what I said？

    ―Sorry．I________a text message just now．

topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查动词的时态。根据“and I'm waiting for the result”可知，考试已经完成，所以用一般过去时态。故选B。

knowledges.name: 词法>>动词时态和语态>>动词时态>>一般过去时

subTopics.desc:
（重庆卷）―Kevin，you look worried． Anything wrong？


   ―Well，I________a test and I'm waiting for the result．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查定语从句。先行词为machine，此处用whose表示“它的”。（注意whose+n．相当于the+n．of which／of which the+n．）

knowledges.name: 句法>>定语从句>>关系代词的用法

subTopics.desc: （山东卷）That's the new machine________parts are too small to be seen．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查定语从句关系词的判断。这里先行词“a person”在从句中作定语，修饰e－mail account，所以应该用whose。

knowledges.name: 句法>>定语从句>>关系代词的用法

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查定语从句。many从属于1000 people．故用of+whom引导定语从句，在从句中作主语。

knowledges.name: 句法>>定语从句>>关系代词的用法

subTopics.desc: （浙江卷）The settlement is home to nearly 1000 people，marly of________left their village homes for a better life in the city．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查连词。句意为：一个人改变习惯是很难的，但是只要有意识并有自制力，是可以做到的。根据前后分句中的“not easy”和“possible”可知，两句话之间为转折关系。故答案选C。

knowledges.name: 词法>>连词和感叹词>>并列连词

subTopics.desc: （重庆卷）It's not easy to change habits，________with awareness and self－control，it is possible．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查介词短语辨析。句意为：如果你能去商店买些我们晚饭所需的东西，那就帮了我们很大的忙。与此同时，我也会布置好桌子的。空格处有“同时，与此同时”的含义，所以in the meanwhile符合题意。as a result意为“结果是”；on the whole意为“总体上”；as a matter of fact意为“事实上”，均与语境不符。故选C项。

knowledges.name: 词法>>介词和介词短语>>介词（短语）辨析

subTopics.desc: （浙江卷）It will be a big help if you go to the store and get what we need for dinner．________，I'll set the table．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查介词。句意为：你认为这件衬衣是不是肩部太紧了？衬衣应该是在“两肩之间”太紧。across表示“在某物体表面横跨，穿过”，符合语境，故答案选D。

knowledges.name: 词法>>介词和介词短语>>介词

subTopics.desc: （北京卷）Do you think this shirt is too tight________the shoulders？

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 考查状语从句的引导词。句意为：把你的钥匙留给你的邻居，以防某天你把你自己锁在外面。as long as只要，引导条件状语从句；even though尽管，引导让步状语从句；in case以防，引导目的状语从句；as if好像，引导方式状语从句或表语从句。根据句意可知选C。

knowledges.name: 词法>>连词和感叹词>>从属连词
句法>>状语从句>>目的状语从句

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.answerHtml:
【小题1】C 【小题2】B 【小题3】A 【小题4】C 【小题5】D
【小题6】A 【小题7】B 【小题8】A 【小题9】C 【小题10】C
【小题11】B 【小题12】D 【小题13】B 【小题14】C 【小题15】D
【小题16】C 【小题17】D 【小题18】A 【小题19】D 【小题20】C
topicDetail.analysisHtml:
【文章大意】本文是一篇记叙文。小女孩住在简陋的房子里。她总是梦想住到山对面的那所金房子里。有一天她终于得到允许，骑车来到金房子，却发现房子普通而且很脏。转身望去，她却发现自己原本就住在充满关爱的金房子里。羡慕他人的却没意识到自己已经拥有的。

【解析】（1）考查情态动词。根据本句中的“Usually”和“play in the small garden”可知，小女孩过去常常在小花园里玩耍。情态动词would意为“过去常常”，符合语境。故答案选C。


（2）考查连词辨析。根据下文“she desired to live in such a house”可知，她希望住进这样一所房子里，由此推断出，逗号前后两分句是让步关系，“尽管她爱她的父母和家庭”，符合逻辑关系。故答案选B。


（3）考查动词辨析。根据文章最后一句“Everything she dreamed was right there in front of her nose！”可知，所有她梦想的东西就在她面前。所以此处本句句意为：她渴望住在那样的房子里而且整天都会梦想住在那里一定会感觉有多么美好多么必奋。故答案选A。


（4）考查代词辨析。分析句式结构可知，句子“she desired to live in such a house and________all day about how wonderful and exciting________must feel to live there．”中真正的主语是不定式“to live there”，空格处需要代词it作形式主语。还原句子为“to live there must feel wonderful and exciting”。故答案选C。


（5）考查形容词辨析。根据下文可知，她骑车来到她梦想的金房子那儿，但是看到的房了令她失望，而回头看却发现自己的家就是一座金房子，这说明这时她已经具备基本能力和识别力了。basic skill意为“基本能力”，固定搭配。故答案选D。different意为“小同的”；scientific意为“科学的”；musical意为“悦耳的”，均不符合语境。


（6）考查动词辨析。根据下文“Her mother finally allowed her to go”可知。此处指小女儿请求妈妈让她骑车出去。beg意为“请求”，符合语境。blame意为“谴责”；invite意为“邀请”；pay意为“付款”。故答案选A。


（7）考查介词辨析。根据本段最后一句“________the hill and across the valley．she rode to the________of the golden house．”可知，小女孩沿着山坡骑下去然后穿过山谷，来到了金房子，女孩从她常常玩耍的花园骑车出去了。放答案选B。


（8）考查动词短语辨析。根据本句中的“keeping close to the house and not________too far”可知，妈妈虽然同意女孩骑车出去，却坚持让女孩就在房子附近，不要骑得太远。insist on意为“坚持”；rely on意为“依靠”；argue about意为“争论”；wonder about意为“对……感到奇怪”。故答案选A。


（9）考查动词辨析。根据上文“she________her mother for a bike ride________the garden”可知，女孩请求妈妈允许她骑车出去，妈妈不让她骑得太远。故答案选C。


（10）考查副词辨析。根据第一段中“she desired to live in such a house and________all day about how wonderful and exciting________must feel to live there．”可知，女孩整天梦想住在另一座山上的金房子里，所以她准确地知道要骑车去哪里。exactly意为“准确地”，符合语境。故答案选C。


（11）考查介词辨析。根据下文“valley”可知，山谷在两山之间，可以推断女孩是往山下骑车，到达山谷后，再穿越山谷，到达另一座山上的金房子。故答案选B。


（12）考查名词辨析。根据下文“put it against the gate post”可知，此处指女孩骑车来到金房子的大门口。故答案选D。


（13）考查连词辨析。句意为：当他下车把车倚靠在前门柱时……as可作连词，意为“当……时候”，引导时间状语从句，符合语境，故答案选B。until用在肯定句中时，动词应为延续性动词。


（14）考查动词辨析。根据语境可知，女孩骑在通往金房子的路上。lead to意为“通向”，符合语境。故答案选C。


（15）考查动词辨析。根据上文“She was very disappointed”可知，女孩十分失望，因为她发现金房子的所有的窗户都很普通而且非常脏。find意为“发现”，符合语境。故答案选D。


（16）考查形容词辨析。根据本句中的“rather dirty”可知，女孩看到的金房子和想象中的不一样，根据and可知，此处所填词和“rather dirty”并列，形容词plain意为“朴素的，简单的”，符合语境。故答案选C。


（17）考查形容词辨析。根据下文“and heart－broken”可知，女孩发现这所房子太普通太脏了，有些难过。故答案选D。


（18）考查动词短语辨析。根据下文“There on the other side of the valley was a little house and its windows were golden．”可知，在山谷的另一面有座小房子，它的窗是金色的。在这座房子前面要想看到山谷另一边的房子必须要转身才能看到。故答案选A。


（19）考查名词辨析。根据上文“So and heart－broken”及下文“There on the other side of the valley was a little house and its windows were golden．”可知，当小女孩正难过时，却看到了山谷另一边的金房子，这个景象令人惊异。故答案选D。


（20）考查动词辨析。根据下文“she had been living in her golden house filled with love and care．”可知，小女孩由原来羡慕另一座山上的金房子，希望离开自己家住在那里，到发现自己的家就是一座金房子，所以小女孩意识到其实她就住在充满关怀和爱的金房子里。故答案选C。

topicDetail.material:
A little girl lived in a simple and poor house on a hill．Usually she____16____play in the small garden．She could see over the garden fence and across the valley a wonderful house with shining golden windows high on another hill．____17____she loved her parents and her family，she desired to live in such a house and____18____all day about how wonderful and exciting____19____must feel to live there．

    At the age when she gained some____20____skill and sensibility（识别力），she____21____her mother for a bike ride____22____the garden．Her mother finally allowed her to go，____23____her keeping close to the house and not____24____too far．The day was beautiful．The little girl knew____25____where she was heading！____26____the hill and across the valley，she rode to the____27____of the golden house．

    ____28____she got off her bike and put it against the gate post，she focused on the path____29____to the house and then on the house itself．She was very disappointed when she____30____that all the windows were____31____and rather dirty．

    So____32____and heart－broken，She didn't go any further．She____33____，and all of a sudden she saw an amazing____34____．There on the other side of the valley was a little house and its windows were golden．Looking at her little home，she____35____that she had been living in her golden house filled with love and care．Everything she dreamed was right there in front of her nose！

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.answerHtml: 【小题1】B 【小题2】A 【小题3】D 【小题4】A
topicDetail.analysisHtml:
【文章大意】本文是一则产品广告。主要对EP便携式加热器的优点和特色进行了相关介绍。

 【解析】（1）段落人意题。根据第二段内容可知，EP便携式加热器不会引起火灾。孩子接触其表面时也不会被烫伤。由此可知，本段主要介绍了这种加热器的安全性。故答案选B。


（2）细节理解题。根据第三段第一句“The EP will not reduce oxygen in the room”可知，这种加热器不会消耗室内的氧气。故答案选A。


（3）词义猜测题。根据第四段最后一句“With the EP，the temperature will not vary in any part of the room．”可知，EP便携式加热器能够使房间均衡受热。因此，evenly应为“均衡地（equally）”之意。故答案选D。


（4）写作意图题。通读全文，特别是文章最后一段“Take action right now！”可知，本文是一则广告，其目的是向读者推荐这种产品，吸引读者去购买。故答案选A。

topicDetail.material:
（北京卷）

EP Portable Heater

    We all know that the cost of heating our homes will continue to be a significant burden on the family budget．Now millions of people are saving on their heating bills with the EP portable heater．With over one million satisfied customers around the world，the new EP heats better and faster，saves more on heating bills，and runs almost silent．

    The EP has no exposed heating parts that can cause a fire．The outside of the EP only gets warm to the touch so that it will not burn children or pets．

    The EP will not reduce oxygen in the room．With other heaters，you'll notice that you get sleepy when the heat comes on because they are burning tip oxygen．

    The advanced EP also heats the room evenly，wall to wall and floor to ceiling．It comfortably covers an arca up to 350 square feet．Other heaters heat rooms unevenly with  most of the heat concentrated to the center of the room．And they only heat all area a few feet around the heater．With the EP，the temperature will not vary in any part of the room．

    The EP comes with a 3－year warranty（保修）and a 60－day，no questions asked，satisfaction guarantee．If you are not totally satisfied，return it at our expense and your money will be given back to you．

    Now we have a special offer for 10 days，during which you can enjoy a half price discount and a free delivery．If you order after that，we reserve the right to either accept or reject order requests at the discounted price．

    Take action right now！

subTopics.desc: What is mainly discussed in Paragraph 2？
From the passage，we can learn that the EP________．

options.desc: is unsuitable for children and pets

subTopics.desc: The underlined word“evenly”in Paragraph 4 probably meams________．
The main purpose of the passage is to________．

options.desc: persuade people to buy the product
advise people to save on heating bills
report the new development of portable heaters
compare the functions of different heater brands

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.answerHtml: 【小题1】C 【小题2】B 【小题3】A 【小题4】D
topicDetail.analysisHtml:
【文章大意】风能是最清洁最充裕的能源，早在公元前7世纪人们就开始使用风能了。当今由于环境污染以及资源的日益减少，全球将动员通过使用风能供应更多的电能。

【解析】（1）推理判断题。根据第二段第二、三句“When electricity was discovered in the late 1800s，people living in remote areas began to use them to produce electricity．This allowed them to have electric lights and radio．”可知，C项正确。


（2）细节理解题。根据第二段第二句活“When electricity was discovered in the late 1800s，people living in remote areas began to use them to produce electricity．”可知，应选B。


（3）推理判断题。根据第三段中的“people started becoming concerned about the pollution that is created when coal and gas are burned to produce electricity…Then，wind was rediscovered…”可知，A项正确。


（4）推理判断题。文章最后一段提到由于环境污染以及资源的日益减少，风能被重新用来供应更多的电能。因此下文将会讨论全球利用风能发电的趋向。故选D。

topicDetail.material:
（安徽卷）

    Think about the different ways that people use the wind．You can use it to fly a kite or to sail a boat．Wind is one of our cleanest and richest power sources（来源），as well as one of the oldest．Evidence shows that windmills（风车）began to be used in ancient Iran back in the seventh century BC．They were first introduced to Europe during the 1100s，when armies returned from the Middle East with knowledge of using wind power．

    For many centuries，people used windmills to grind（磨碎） wheat into flour or pump water from deep underground．When electricity was discovered in the late 1800s，people living in remote areas began to use them to produce electricity．This allowed them to have electric lights and radio．However，by the 1940s when electricity was available to people in almost all areas of the United States，windmills were rarely used．

    During the 1970s，people started becoming concerned about the pollution that is created when coal and gas are burned to produce electricity．People also realized that the supply of coal and gas would not last forever．Then，wind was rediscovered，though it means higher costs．Today，there is a global movement to supply more and more of our electricity through the use of wind．

subTopics.desc: From the text we know that windmills________．

options.desc: have a history of more than 2800 years
used to supply power to radio in remote areas
have rarely been used since electricity was discovered

subTopics.desc: What was a new use for wind power in the late 19th century？
One of the reasons wind was rediscovered in the 1970s is that________．

options.desc: it is one of the oldest power sources
it was cheaper to create energy from wind
the supply of coal and gas failed to meet needs

subTopics.desc: What would the author probably discuss in the paragraph that follows？

options.desc: The design of wind power plants．
The worldwide movement to save energy．
The global trend towards producing power from wind

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.answerHtml: 【小题1】B 【小题2】A 【小题3】B
topicDetail.analysisHtml:
【文章大意】本文是一篇记叙文。文章讲述了丹佛市中心的一家咖啡馆慷慨的经营理念。咖啡馆的经营者本着信任他人的理念传播这种慷慨的精神。

【解析】（1）细节理解题。根据第三段第二句“Previously volunteering at soup kitchens，the Birkys were dissatisfied with the often unhealthy meals they served there．”可知，以前在流动厨房做义工，Birkys一家对他们那经常供应的不健康的食物感到不满意。故选B。


（2）细节理解题。根据第二段最后一句中的“Those unable to pay for their meals can instead volunteer as waiters and waitresses，and dishwashers，or look after the buildings and equipment for the cafe．”可知，那些没能力支付餐费的人可以做诸如服务员、洗碗工或者为咖啡馆照看大楼以及设备的志愿者。故选A。


（3）推理判断题。根据最后一段第二句中“And the spirit of generosity behind the project appears to be spreading．”可以推测出，作者对经营这样的咖啡馆持赞成的态度。故选B。

阅读理解>>题材>>日常生活类

topicDetail.material:
（辽宁卷）

    Inside the pleasingly fragrant care．So All May Eat （SAME） in downtown Denver，the spirit of generosity（慷慨） is instantly noticeable：A donation box stands in place of a cash register．Customers here pay only what they can afford，no questions asked．

    A risky business plan，perhaps，but SAME Cafe has done one unchangeable thing in the Mile High City for six years:Open only at midday，the restaurant provides poor local people with healthy，delicious lunches six days a week．Those unable to pay for their meals can instead volunteer as waiters and waitresses，and dishwashers，or look after the buildings and equipment for the cafe．

    “It's based on trust．and it's working all right，”says co－owner Brad Birky，who started the cafe in 2006 with his wife Libby．Previously volunteering at soup kitchens，tile Birkys were dissatisfied with the often unhealthy meals they served there．

    “We wanted to offer quality food in a restaurant where everyone felt comfortable，regardless of their circumstances，”Birky says．SAME's special lunch menu changes daily and most food materials are natural and grown by local farmers．

    The cafe now averages 65 to 70 customers （and eight volunteers） a day．And the spirit of generosity behind the project appears to be spreading．In early 2007，one volunteer who had cleared snow for his meals during the long winter said goodbye to the Birkys．“He said he was going to New Orleans to help with the hurricane cleanup，”says Birky．

subTopics.desc: What can we learn about the soup kitchens the Birkys previously worked for？

options.desc: They provided customers with a good environment．
They closed down because of poor management．

subTopics.desc: According to the passage，which of the following is TRUE？

options.desc: The customers who cannot pay can work as volunteers instead．
More volunteers will go to New Orleans for the hurricane cleanup．
Many new cafes will be opened to offer free lunches in the town．
The lunch menu has remained the same since the cafe was started．

subTopics.desc: The author's attitude towards running such a cafe is________．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.answerHtml: 【小题1】D 【小题2】C 【小题3】B 【小题4】B
topicDetail.analysisHtml:
【文章大意】文章通过介绍画家Frida Kahlo的人生经历和绘画历程，表现了作者对画家命运以及在有生之年未得到应有赞誉的同情之心。

【解析】（1）理解判断题。画线句句意为：让人伤心的是，她现在实际上比她在世的时候更著名，因此可推断出“a much bigger name”意为：一个更加著名的人，即a much more famous person。故选D项。


（2）细节理解题。根据第二段中的“her back was broken in several places in a school－bus accident”可知，她的背在一次校车事故中受伤了；“but nothing was able to cure the terrible pain in her back”可知，但是没有什么能够治愈她背上严重的疼痛。故选C项。



（3）细节理解题。根据第三段第二句可知，但是她从20世纪40年代开始的后期作品今天被认为是她最优秀的作品，几乎没有受到她丈夫的影响，即独立性越来越强。故选B项。


（4）推理判断题。文章叙述了画家Frida Kahlo长期受背痛之苦，以及在她在世时作品未得到应有的赏识的事实，并用了sadly（在第一段最后一句“Sadly，she is actually a much bigger name today than she was during her time．”中意思是“令人伤心的”）等包含情感与观点的词语，所以可以看出作者对画家Frith Kahlo的态度是sympathy，即同情。故选B项。

topicDetail.material:
D  （安徽卷）

    When Frida Kahlo's paintings were on show in London，a poet described her paintings as“a ribbon（丝带） around a bomb”．Such comments seem to suggest Kahlo had a big influence on the art world of her time．Sadly，she is actually a much bigger name today than she was during her time．

    Born in 1907 in a village near Mexico City，Kahlo suffered from polio（小儿麻痹症）at the age of seven．Her spine（脊柱）became bent as she grew older．Then，in 1925，her back was broken in several places in a school－bus accident．Throughout the rest of her life，the artist had many operations，but nothing was able to cure the terrible pain in her back．However，the accident had an unexpected side effect．While lying in her bed recovering，Kahlo taught herself to paint．

    In 1929，she got married to Diego Rivera，another famous Mexican artist．Rivera's strong influence on Kahlo's style can be seen in her early works，but her later works from the 1940s，known today as her best works，show less influence from her husband．

    Unfortunately，her works did not attract much attention in the 1930s and 1940s，even in her home country．Her first one－woman show in Mexico was not held until 1953．For more than a decade after her death in 1954，Kahlo's works remained largely unnoticed by the world，but in the 1970s her works began to gain international fame at last．

subTopics.desc: What does the phrase“a much bigger name”in Paragraph 1 most nearly mean？
The terrible pain Kahlo suffered was caused by________．
Kahlo's style had become increasingly independent since the________．
What is the author's attitude toward Kahlo？

topicDetail.material:
A．Adults keep pets with their children． 
B．Pet－keeping has a very long history． 
C．Pet－keeping may do harm to animals． 
D．People keep pets for their aesthetic need． 
E．Caged pets become increasingly popular． 
F．Pet－keeping is helpful for children's growth． 
（1）__________________ 
  Pet－keeping is a time－honoured tradition．One of the reasons for people to raise dogs or cows was usefulness．While people in the past hunted animals and kept them in their backyards，the civilized man today is less cruel towards them and is less exploitative（利用的）． 
（2） __________________ 
    We keep animals as pets because they are attractive．We all have the urge to possess something that has aesthetic（美学的）value，and that is why we treasure paintings or fine furniture．Keeping pets is one form of this urge．A Siamese cat in the house can be a decorative object．Pets are playful animals and they amuse us．A little rabbit amuses us by its playful and lively runs． 
（3） __________________ 
    Many parents find it helpful to have pets in the house for their children．Having pets is an excellent way of developing in children the love of animals and responsibility．Children get the opportunity to take on full responsibility for another creature's life．It will be an educational experience for a child to watch the natural life cycle of an animal．There are psychological（心理的） benefits for children．Pets are welcome friends for children who are lonely．Pets are excellent companions．Keeping pets means 
 giving love and being loved．We find comfort in giving care and receiving care in return．We get pleasure from their appearance and their behaviour． 
（4） __________________ 
    As more people move into apartments，there are limitations on keeping of animals like dogs and monkeys．Therefore，caged animals have increased in popularity．Birds fall into this group．We keep them for their beautiful songs and feathers．Fish－keeping is a widespread hobby and the keeper can observe their behaviour in the glass tank and study its entire life cycle．The cat is a fine house pet and it fits nearly into human habitation（居住地） without requiring its own cage．They are wonderful 
hunters，if there are rats around． 
（5） __________________ 
    Pets satisfy man's desire to care for a bit of nature．The pet owner has the responsibility for supplying those needs that nature provides．Pets are amusing and entertaining，but we are in a way doing animals harm by making them live in a human environment．Are we not enslaving（奴役）them？

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.answerHtml:
I hardly remember my grandmother．She used to me on her knees and sing old songs．I was only four when she  away．She is just a distant memory for me now．

    I remember my grandfather very ．He was tall，with broad  and a beard that turned from black  gray over the years．He had a deep voice，which set  apart from others in our small town， he was strong and powerful．In  fact，he even scared my classmates away  they came over to play or do homework with me．However，he was the gentlest man I have  known．
topicDetail.analysisHtml: 略。

    I remember my grandfather very ．He was tall，with broad  and a beard that turned from black  gray over the years．He had a deep voice，which set  apart from others in our small town， he was strong and powerful．In  fact，he even scared my classmates away  they came over to play or do homework with me．However，he was the gentlest man I have  known．

subTopics.desc:
假定英语课上老师要求同桌之间交换修改作文，请你修改你同桌写的以下作文。文中共有10处语言错误，每句中最多有两处。每处错误仅涉及一个单词的增加、删除或修改。

    增加：在缺词处加一个漏字符号（  ），并在其下面写出该加的词。

    删除：把多余的词用斜线（＼）划掉。

    修改：在错的词下画一横线，并在该词下面写出修改后的词。

    注意：

    1．每处错误及其修改均仅限一词；

    2．只允许修改10处，多者（从第11处起）不计分。

    I hardly remember my grandmother．She  used to holding me on her knees and sing old songs．I was only four when she passes away．She is just a distant memory for me now．

    I remember my grandfather very much．He Was tall，with broad shoulder and a beard that turned from black toward gray over the years．He had a deep voice，which set himself apart from others in our small town，he was strong and powerful．In a fact，he even scared my classmates away during they came over to play or do homework with me．However，he was the gentlest man I have never known．
subTopics.answer:
I hardly remember my grandmother．She used to me on her knees and sing old songs．I was only four when she  away．She is just a distant memory for me now．

    I remember my grandfather very ．He was tall，with broad  and a beard that turned from black  gray over the years．He had a deep voice，which set  apart from others in our small town， he was strong and powerful．In  fact，he even scared my classmates away  they came over to play or do homework with me．However，he was the gentlest man I have  known．

topicDetail.paperName: 英语必修2对接高考模块仿真演练
topicDetail.answerHtml:
Dear Tom，

  How are you doing？I wonder if you could sell some Chinese knots for me．I made them myself with red silk threads，cloth and other materials．They look really beautiful in the shape of a diamond，about 5 inches long and 4 inches wide．In China，these knots stand for friendship，love and good luck．People can either give them as gifts to friends or hang them in their

houses．They are only 12.99 US dollars each．If anyone wants to know more about the knots，let them write to me．Also，do let me know if you need further information．Thank you！

                                                                                                                                                                      Li Hua
topicDetail.analysisHtml:
本文属于半开放提纲类作文，体裁属于书信类说明文。这类书面表达的特点是：体裁多以考生熟悉的书信、通知、日记为主，题材一般都贴近考生生活实际。同时提纲既体现了文章的层次，又规定了各段的大体内容，为考生提供了写作思路。考生只要稍加思索、计划、整理即可成文。此类书面表达的常见写作步骤为：1．审题：包括文章的体裁、要点、人称、时态等。就本文而言，体裁属于书信类说明文；要点应该包括：（1）说明写信的原因。（2）介绍中国结，主要包括外观、意义以及价格等。（3）恰当合理地结尾。本文人称主要是一、二人称；因为是说明文，时态主要以一般现在时为主，不过根据要点还会用到一般将来时。

2．构思：根据要点，构思写作时需要用到的词语以及句型，从而大致完成写作要点。本文可能会用到的重点词有red silk threads，shape，diamond，stand for，good luck，friendship等；可能用到的句型有Would you mind／please…；not only…but also…；either…or…；I would appreciate it if…等。

3．扩展：根据要求和要点，适当添加语句以及关联词、过渡词，将各个要点连接成文，并且要注意做到语句间逻辑通顺，句式多变，用词灵活。这是体现考生英语水平最重要的依据。

houses．They are only 12.99 US dollars each．If anyone wants to know more about the knots，let them write to me．Also，do let me know if you need further information．Thank you！

                                                                                                                                                                      Li Hua
